answers.text: a period of major scientific advancements

qas.question: What year is considered to be the beginning of the Scientific Revolution?
What book by Andreas Vesalius was published in 1543?

answers.text: De humani corporis fabrica (On the Workings of the Human Body)

qas.question: What was the focus of De Revolutionibus by Nicolaus Copernicus?

answers.text: the Earth moved around the Sun

qas.question: What book was printed by Isaac Newton in 1687?

context: The willingness to question previously held truths and search for new answers resulted in <a0_0>a period of major scientific advancements<a0_0/>, now known as the Scientific Revolution. The Scientific Revolution is traditionally held by most historians to have begun in <a1_0>1543<a1_0/>, when the books <a2_0>De humani corporis fabrica (On the Workings of the Human Body)<a2_0/> by Andreas Vesalius, and also De Revolutionibus, by the astronomer Nicolaus Copernicus, were first printed. The thesis of Copernicus' book was that <a3_0>the Earth moved around the Sun<a3_0/>. The period culminated with the publication of the <a4_0>Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica<a4_0/> in 1687 by Isaac Newton, representative of the unprecedented growth of scientific publications throughout Europe.
